etymologies: mid 17th century: from late Latin ambidexter (from Latin ambi- ‘on both sides’ + dexter ‘right-handed’) + -ous

definitions: (of a person) able to use the right and left hands equally well

examples.text: few of us are naturally ambidextrous

shortDefinitions: able to use right and left hands equally well

definitions: (of an implement) designed to be used by left-handed and right-handed people with equal ease
shortDefinitions: designed to be used by left-handed and right-handed people with equal ease
